string.value: Since adolescent #t1902015# is going through puberty, you should visit #b#p2020007##k of #b#m211000000##k and ask for some good advice.

#p2020007# says that Wolf Pups need to freely run around fields every once in a while and introduces you to a great spot. Head to #m921110000#, located past the #bWolf-Shaped Rock#k in #b#m211050000##k, and let your pup get some exercise running around the field.
You and your wolf ran across the Field of Wolves and got some good exercise. #t1902015# seemed to have really enjoyed the experience.
Hey, aren't you the one that recently started riding the wolf with me? What's going on?\n#b#L0#(You bring out Ryko and ask about wolves' adolescent stages.)#l\n#k

Hmm, it is true that the wolves go through that period of…rebellion. They can get it out of their system, though, simply by running wildly through an open field. I know of a place #bwhere wolves can roam around and run freely#k. Do you want to know where that is?

Out of all the fields in #m211000000#, there's one called #b#m211050000##k. Go up there, past the wolf-shaped rock, and you'll find a field called Rider's Field. It's wide open, and the courses are prime for running. This is where I meet up with a lot of my wolf-riding friends.
I think it'll be a good idea for you to take a ride around that field. That'll really make Ryko's day, as well.
Is that a no…? Are you still not used to Wolf Mounts? If so, then… that's too bad.

You look like you definitely ran a block or two. Even #t1902015# seems satisfied! Hahaha, wolves need to run from time to time, you know. The moment you start riding around the field with that wolf, that's when you'll feel like you two will have become one. Only other riders will understand that feeling!
Keep communicating with your wolf as you ride around with it, okay?
